div.p:
kēdārarāśipaṇḍitu
lakuṁ brahmahatya śrāpi
ñci poḍici koṇi caccina
candrarāśibhaṭārala rūpu
This is the picture of Candrarāśibhaṭāra who accused (someone) of brahmicide of Kēdārarāśipaṇḍitulu, got in close combat, took revenge, and died.

The text follows the edition of H. Krishna Sastri in 2158 in absence of a picture. Following the entry in A. R. No. 471 of 1893 Krishna Sastri edited the text which was written on two faces on a stone slab as one entry with continuous line numbering although the two faces evidently display two distinct inscriptions. They are given here as 58a and 58b respectively. The term rūpu probably refers to a carving that depicts Candrarāśibhaṭāra. However, mention of such a picture is neither made in A. R. nor in . The spelling śrāpiñci (line 2-3) is a mistake for śāpiñci.

The text was edited together with a second inscription on the same stone by H. Krishna Sastri in 2158 without a picture. The text was re-edited by K. M. Sastri (34597) on basis of SII with some errors and without translation.
